intro: Impatiens inconspicua var. inconspicua, commonly known as the slender touch-me-not, is a herbaceous plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring slender, upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, showy flowers in shades of pink and white, which bloom in clusters at the leaf axils. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate, with a smooth or slightly serrated margin. This species is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and stream banks.
